intro: Pygeum salomonense, commonly known as Solomon's African cherry, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
